results.title: Australians at war: 1939-1945: navy, army, airforce
results.creator_credit: John Morris, Stuart Glover, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
During the years 1956-1969 Frank Bagnall produced a series tracing the involvement of the Army, Navy and Airforce services during the Second World War. The series is comprised almost entirely of actual footage and is united by the themes of human effort and sacrifice. The individual episodes are available separately in the collection on 16mm. NAVY: illustrates the conditions of active service in the Royal Australian Navy in the war including missions such as an Island invasion with America, and defending bases in New Guinea and Northern Australia. ARMY: records the Australian soldier’s participation in the Second World War. Covers fighting in Libya, Greece, Crete, Syria and Tripoli, and the Singapore, New Guinea and Borneo campaigns. AIRFORCE: Australian airmen serve their country admirably, earning distinction in areas as widely separated as New Guinea and Europe. Victory comes at a cost however as machines and men are lost in the name of conflict. Repackaged by Film Australia in 1995.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_moP0lr2s1w
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xSlHLFAQlGg&t=13s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3A6szu1ca0Y&t=25s

results.title: Australian Vietnam Forces National Memorial dedication
results.creator_credit: Max Donnellan, Kinsie McDonald and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: This video records the dedication ceremony of the Australian Vietnam forces war memorial, Canberra, in October 1992. The video also contains footage of Australian soldiers in action in the Vietnam conflict, speeches by the Prime Ministers Bob Hawke and Paul Keating, and a tree planting ceremony and speech about the Australian Vietnam Forces Memorial forest comprising a tree for every Australian soldier or civilian who lost their lives during the Vietnam conflict. Commentators include Bruce Webster, Bill Fogarty, Paul Berger and Graham Neil.

results.title: Australian Fibreboard Container
results.brief_description: A film commissioned by the Australian Fibreboard Manufacturers Association and APM to develop and promote cardboard box use. Depicts the logging of eucalypts, log processing, pulping and drying of paper, as well as paper recycling, cardboard processing, different tests for strength and the role of cardboard in packaging.

results.title: Australian dream
results.brief_description: Dorothy Stubbs is married to Queensland’s “Butcher of the Year”, Geoff Stubbs who is campaigning to be Prosperity Party Candidate for suburban Avon Heights. But Dorothy finds something missing in her life, especially when she attends a Sex Aids party and starts to fantasise about the male stripper there- Todd, (also horse-riding instructor, rock singer and petty thief). When Geoff invites the leader of the Prosperity Party to the monthly neighbourhood b-b-q at his house (with the theme “Come as Your Favourite Fantasy”) and Dorothy secretly invites Todd’s band, the dreams of both are destined to collide in an hilarious night of drunkenness and debauchery. Cast: Noni Hazlehurst, Graeme Blundell, John Jarratt, Barry Rugless.

results.title: Australia: room down under
results.creator_credit: Dan Klugherz and Westinghouse Broadcasting Company for Intertel
results.brief_description: This American assessment of Australia gives special attention to our migrant programme and the subtle ways immigrants are changing Australia’s way of life. The question of the White Australia Policy, the contrasts of great cities and desolate interior, and to the arts and sports. Australia as it appears to a newcomer is seen through the impressions of a migrant girl in her unrehearsed discussions with her Australian boyfriend. Film includes interviews with swimming coach Don Talbot, filmmaker Tim Burstall.

results.title: Australia: eye of the storm
results.creator_credit: Ashley Smith, Jeni Clevers, Klaus Toft, Mark Lamble, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Channel 4, Granada Media and Telcast International
results.brief_description: This four part series describes the powerful climate systems that batter Australia and how they affect it’s weather, wildlife and people. Using state-of-the-art cinematography, computer graphics and satellite images, each program traces the development of one climactic force and explains how Australia’s plants and animals cope with these long-term weather events. Forces examined include: ‘La Nina’ (combination of torrential rainfall, cyclones and massive floods); ‘Southern Exposure’ (sudden storms from Antarctica and the Southern Ocean); ‘El Nino’ (droughts and bushfires from heat and lack of water) and ‘Monsoon’ (rainstorms and accompanying sea conditions). Also included in this video is a short program called ‘Stormchasers’ which looks at the making of the other four programs.

results.title: Australia: secrets of the land down under
results.creator_credit: Chip Duncan and International Video Network
results.brief_description: Begin your tour of vast Australia in Sydney, then head to the Blue Mountains, where the squawks of wild parrots are drowned out by Wentworth Falls. Visit Canberra the federal capital, Melbourne, the nation’s financial and cultural centre and then travel across the continent to Perth. Watch the blazing sun paint Ayer’s Rock blood red and complete your visit with stops at Brisbane and the Great Barrier Reef.

results.title: Australia. Ep. 5. Woy Woy to Wagga Wagga
results.brief_description: Spike Milligan takes a journey around “his” Australia, from Woy Woy where his mother lives, to Wagga Wagga - with Sydney and Canberra in between. His journey includes watching the Melbourne Cup with his mother, spinning yarns with locals in a pub, and the search for the great Australian joke. Milligan’s personal insight into Australia and Australians is both humorous and an interesting retrospective of the country in the 1980’s.

results.title: Australia in the 80's
results.creator_credit: John Leake, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film presents the variety and vigour of a nation still developing. Includes sequences of travel on the famous Indian Pacific railway between Port Pirie and Kalgoorlie, the nomad aircraft coastal surveillance, the gasfields of Moomba, and the Sepeltsfield wine-growing area in the Barossa Valley
